snippet: Gov. Pat Quinn made major changes Tuesday to a concealed carry measure, including setting a one-gun limit on the number of firearms a person can carry.
abstract: Illinois Gov Pat Quinn makes major changes to concealed carry measure, including setting one-gun limit on number of firearms a person can carry and banning weapons from places where alcohol is served; uses his amendatory veto power to change legislation sent to him after months of intense debate and compromise.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Pat Quinn made major changes Tuesday to a concealed carry measure, including setting a one-gun limit on the number of firearms a person can carry.

headline.main: Illinois: Governor’s Changes Put Gun Bill Back on Lawmakers’ Table
headline.print_headline: Illinois: Governor’s Changes Put Gun Bill Back On Lawmakers’ Table
